thread.title: BREAKING: Shots Fired At U.K. Parliament, A Dozen People Injured: UPDATED
thread.title_full: BREAKING: Shots Fired At U.K. Parliament, A Dozen People Injured: UPDATED

author: Andrew Mark Miller
title: BREAKING: Shots Fired At U.K. Parliament, A Dozen People Injured: UPDATED
text:
BREAKING: Two people shot outside UK parliament, building in lock down – parliamentary official pic.twitter.com/DEL2v9RRvB  3'); }); 
— Reuters Top News (@Reuters) March 22, 2017 Breaking: Shooting incident at Parliament. Ministers being evacuated. pic.twitter.com/HGrrWh08zj 
— Tom Newton Dunn (@tnewtondunn) March 22, 2017 LATEST: At least a dozen injured people on Westminster Bridge near UK parliament: Reuters photographer 
— Reuters Top News (@Reuters) March 22, 2017 #BREAKING : Reports of possible gunfire near Britain's Parliament https://t.co/uDvLZBUHGP pic.twitter.com/FPdS0PooOW 
From Right Scoop : 
A man has been shot inside the gates of the Houses of Parliament. 
A police officer is reportedly down and CPR is being performed, after three or four shots were fired within the gates of New Palace Yard. 
Reports from inside the House of Commons suggest a second man is being held on the ground with a knife to his throat 
Armed police were seen running towards the exit of the Parliamentary estate. 
The House of Commons has been suspended, and MPs have been asked to stay in the chamber. 
The information is still being sorted through but clearly something serious happened here. 
Too early to tell if this was related to radical Islam. 
We will update this article as reports come in… 
UPDATES: 
— CBS News (@CBSNews) March 22, 2017 SAS now deployed. UK Parliament #London from reports one guy rammed people w/ car then got out with a knife. Developing.. 
— Nick Short (@PoliticalShort) March 22, 2017 LATEST: Reports of many injured, shots fired near UK Parliament. https://t.co/weI22El8eU pic.twitter.com/2KAA6IPb12 
— NBC Nightly News (@NBCNightlyNews) March 22, 2017 #BreakingNews : Policeman stabbed inside perimeter of UK Parliament before officers shot the attacker, lawmaker says. https://t.co/PTdObjoYDE pic.twitter.com/WwT7f3lAeG 
— FOX Business (@FoxBusiness) March 22, 2017 Parliament Square silent other than police helicopter overhead. No movement, no sirens, just police securing the area. pic.twitter.com/hefaRt3Q28 
— Jim Waterson (@jimwaterson) March 22, 2017 Police confirm they are treating the attack near #Parliament in #Westminster as a terrorist incident pic.twitter.com/hUkUKoSFfX
